item.title: To extend to Nepal certain preferential treatment with respect to apparel articles.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance. (text of measure as introduced: CR S4001)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S4000-4001)

summary.text: Allows certain apparel articles that are imported directly into the customs territory of the United States from Nepal during FY 2004 through 2005 to enter free of duty and free of any quantitative limitations as if they were articles of a lesser developed beneficiary sub-Saharan African country under the African Growth and Opportunity Act, if Nepal has satisfied specified requirements.

bill.title: A bill to extend to Nepal certain preferential treatment with respect to apparel articles.

item.title: A bill to extend to Nepal certain preferential treatment with respect to apparel articles.
A bill to extend to Nepal certain preferential treatment with respect to apparel articles.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance. (text of measure as introduced: CR S4001)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
